title: Mary Lou Williams - Chronological Classics 1927-40
description:
MARY LOU WILLIAMS - CHRONOLOGICAL CLASSICS 1927-1940

This is a nice new clean rip of a CD in perfect condition.

1. Midnight Stomp (Williams)
2. The Bumps (Williams)
3. Down In The Gallion (unknown)
4. Goose Grease (unknown)
5. Pee Wee Blues (unknown)
6. Now Cut Loose ( unknown)
7. Night Life (Williams)
8. Drag 'Em (Williams)
9. Corny Rhythm (Williams)
10. Overhand (New Froggy Bottom) (Williams)
11. Isabelle (Williams)
12. Swingin' For Joy (Williams)
13. Clean Pickin' (Williams)
14. Mary's Special (Williams)
15. The Pearls (Morton)
16. Mr. Freddie Blues (Shayne)
17. Sweet (Patootie) Patunia (Rogan-Williams-Alexander)
18. The Rocks (Burley)
19. Little Joe From Chicago (Williams-Wells)
20. Mary Lou Williams Blues (Williams)
21. Tea For Two (Youmans-Caesar)
22. Scratchin' The Gravel (Williams)
23. Zonky (Waller-Razaf)
24. Baby Dear (Moten-Hayes)
25. Harmony Blues (Moten)

1-2: Jeanette's Synco Jazzers: Henry McCord (t); Bradley Bullet (tb); John Willims (as, bsx); Mary Leo Burley (Mary Lou Williams) (p); Joe Williams (bj); Robert Price (d)
Recorded in Chicago, January 1927

3-4: John Williams Synco Jazzers: Henry McCord (t); Bradley Bullet (tb); John Willims (as, bsx); Mary Leo Burley (Mary Lou Williams) (p); Joe Williams (bj); Robert Price (d)
Recorded in Chicago, February 1927

5-6: John Williams Synco Jazzers: Henry McCord (t); Bradley Bullet (tb); John Willims (as, bsx); Mary Leo Burley (Mary Lou Williams) (p); Joe Williams (bj); Robert Price (d)
Recorded in Chicago, March 7, 1927

7-8: Mary Lou Williams - piano solos
Recorded in Chicago, April 24, 1930

9-11: Mary Lou Williams - piano; acc. by Booker Collin (b); Ben Thigpen (d)
Recorded in New York, March 7, 1936

12-13: Mary Lou Williams - piano; acc. by Booker Collin (b); Ben Thigpen (d)
Recorded in New York, March 11, 1936

14: Mary Lou Williams - piano & celeste; acc. by Ted Robinson (g)
Recorded in New York, April 9, 1936

15-18: Mary Lou Williams - piano solos
Recorded in New York, Sept 14, 1938

19: Mary Lou Williams - piano solo
Recorded in New York, October 12, 1939

20-23: Six Men And A Girl: Earl Thompson (t); arl "Buddy" Miller (cl, as); Dick Wilson (ts); Mary Lou Wilson (p); Floyd Smith (elec g); Booker Collins (b); Ben Thigpen (d)
Recorded Jan 26, 1940

24-25: Mary Lou Williams And Her Kansas City Seven: Harold Baker (t); Ted Donelly (tb); Edward Inge (cl); Dick Wilsoj (ts); Mary Lou Wilson (p); Booker Collins (b); Ben Thigpen (d)
Recorded in New York November 18, 1940

1992 Classics Records
